sources.full: Tierras Devastadas Path of the Maniac Berserker

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Maniac Berserker
entries: For some Barbarians, fury is only the means to achieve an objective, the objective being violence. The path of the Berserker is a path of limitless violence soaked in blood. When you enter the berserker rage, you enjoy the chaos of battle, without worries such as your health or safety.

subclassFeature.name: Frenzy
entries: Starting at 3rd level, your reckless attacks turn fury into a state of frenzy that alters your mind in search of violence. While raging, all the attacks on your turn can become reckless attacks, and you can make a melee reckless attack with your bonus action. Additionally, as part of your bonus action for entering a frenzy, you can make a reckless attack with a melee weapon.

subclassFeature.name: Intimidating Presence
entries: Your imposture and build passively help to impose your will on others, allowing you to use your strength modifier instead of charisma on your charisma ({@skill intimidation}) rolls

subclassFeature.name: Simple Mind
entries: At 6th level, You cannot be {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened} while raging. If you are {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened} when you go into a rage, the effect is suspended for the duration of the rage.
Additionally, if you take damage from a creature and are not enraged, you can use your reaction to scream or laugh maniacally and enter rage before taking damage.

subclassFeature.name: Negligent Attack
entries: When you hit with a reckless attack you can roll one of your hit dice to add it as damage to one of your attacks. Additionally, if you find yourself {@condition grappled}, instead of dealing extra damage with this trait you can choose to break free as part of the attack. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your strength modifier per short rest.

subclassFeature.name: Violent Retaliation
entries: While enraged, when you take damage from a creature you can use your reaction to move closer to your attacker or another hostile creature, using up to half your movement to make a melee attack against it.
